name: Public Service Rules (PSR) Continuation
description: Remaining modules covering essential governance, HR, and ethical frameworks necessary for Directorate level function.

subcategories.name: Appointments, Promotions & Transfers
subcategories.description: Rules governing recruitment, confirmation, career progression, tenure policy, secondment, and transfer (Chapter 2, 3).

questions.question: The primary body vested with the power to dismiss and exercise disciplinary control over officers in the Federal Civil Service is the:
options: Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
Permanent Secretary of the relevant MDA
questions.explanation: The Federal Civil Service Commission (FCSC) is vested with the power to dismiss and exercise disciplinary control over officers in the Federal Civil Service (Rule 100102).

questions.question: For an officer on Grade Level 07‚Äì14, what is the minimum number of years required in the current post before being considered for promotion?
questions.explanation: For Grade Levels 07‚Äì14, the minimum period in post before consideration for promotion is 3 years (Rule 020802(c)).
questions.chapter: Chapter 2 ‚Äì Minimum Years in Post for Promotion

questions.question: The tenure policy for a Director (or equivalent) states they shall hold office for a firm term of four years and renewable for a further term of four years, subject only to:
questions.explanation: A Director or its equivalent... shall hold office for a firm term of four years and renewable for a further term of four years, subject to satisfactory performance and no more (Rule 020909).

questions.question: All officers appointed directly to the Foreign Service shall be on probation for a period of:
questions.explanation: All Officers appointed directly to the Foreign Service shall be on probation for two years.

questions.question: The mandatory retirement age for all grades in the Service is:
options: 55 years of age or 30 years of service
65 years of age or 35 years of service
60 years of age or 35 years of service
50 years of age or 25 years of service
questions.explanation: The mandatory retirement age for all grades in the Service shall be 60 years or 35 years of pensionable service whichever is earlier (Rule 020908).

questions.question: Promotion should be made strictly on the basis of competitive merit from amongst all eligible candidates. In assessing merit, primary consideration should be given to:
options: Seniority and previous records of service
Ability, competence, and performance records in lower grades
questions.explanation: In assessing the merit of Officers, a clear distinction shall be made between their records of performance or efficiency in lower grades and their potential for promotion, i.e., ability and competence to perform the duties and responsibilities of the higher post efficiently (Rule 020802(d)(i)).

questions.question: The decision whether an acting appointment is necessary or desirable in any particular case (for posts lower than SGL 14 Chief X Officer) rests with:
options: The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation
questions.explanation: The decision whether an acting appointment is necessary or desirable in any particular case will rest with the Federal Civil Service Commission/Board (Rule 020702).

questions.question: The maximum period for which the period of acting appointment shall run, excluding exceptional circumstances, is:
questions.explanation: The period of acting appointment shall not exceed one year, but in exceptional circumstances may be extended for another one year (Rule 020704(b)).

questions.question: What documentation is required to be entered by a newly appointed Officer immediately upon assuming duty?
options: Personal Particulars on Form Gen. 60 (Staff Records Form)
questions.explanation: Immediately a newly appointed Officer assumes duty, he shall be required to enter his Personal Particulars on Form Gen. 60 (Staff Records Form) (Rule 020209).

questions.question: Which officer category is handled by the Junior Staff Committee for appointment and discipline in Federal Government parastatals?
questions.explanation: There shall be established appropriate staff committee (i.e. Junior Staff Committee) in Federal Government parastatals to handle all matters of appointments, promotion and discipline of Officers (Rule 170301). The Junior Staff Committee traditionally handles GL 01‚Äì06.

questions.question: The period of secondment to another Government, approved body or recognized international organization shall not exceed:
questions.explanation: The period of secondment shall not exceed six years (Rule 020504(g)).

questions.question: When an Officer is seconded, the responsibility for paying the Officer‚Äôs emoluments primarily rests with:
options: The Office of the Accountant General of the Federation
questions.explanation: During the period of such secondment, the benefiting organization shall be responsible for the Officer‚Äôs emoluments (Rule 020504).
questions.chapter: Chapter 2 ‚Äì Payment of Salary on Secondment

questions.question: Which principle must appointments into all grades in Parastatals adhere to, ensuring merit and equity?
questions.explanation: Appointments into all grades in Parastatals shall be need-based and subject to the approval of the supervisory Boards/Councils. Such appointments shall be made through a fair and open selection process that ensures merit, credibility and equal employment opportunity for all with due regard to the Federal Character Principle (Rule 170302).

questions.question: The purpose of 'Acting Appointment' is NOT intended as a means of testing the suitability of Officers for promotion. True or False?
questions.explanation: Acting appointment is not intended as a means of testing the suitability of Officers for promotion; they will normally be made only in order to fill posts that are temporarily vacant and their duration should be limited accordingly (Rule 020703).

questions.question: The promotion of Permanent Secretaries is overseen by which Office?
options: Office of the Head of Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
questions.explanation: The Office of the Head of Civil Service of the Federation oversees promotion of Permanent Secretaries (Rule 020811‚Äì020813).

questions.question: Which document must every newly employed Officer/Staff sign in his/her Ministry/Extra-Ministerial Office?
options: Oath of Secrecy (or Oath of Security on Form 1)
questions.explanation: It is the duty of every Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra Ministerial Office to ensure that all newly employed Officers/Staff in his Ministry/Extra-Ministerial Office sign an Oath of Secrecy or Oath of Security (Form 1) (Rule 020210).

questions.question: The emoluments and incremental date of an Officer on transfer is governed by which Rule?
questions.explanation: The emoluments and incremental date of an Officer on transfer is governed by Rule 040103.

questions.question: Which rule dictates that payment of promotion arrears shall be made within the year promotion is effected?
questions.explanation: Payment of promotion arrears shall be made within the year promotion is effected (Rule 040104(iii)).

questions.question: An officer who is eligible to sit for promotion exams while on approved secondment or study leave is doing so to prevent:
questions.explanation: Officers on approved secondment or study leave are eligible to sit promotion exams to avoid stagnation and ensure career progression while away (Rule 020807).

questions.question: The general period of probation for a newly appointed officer is:
questions.explanation: The minimum period of probation is two years from the date of first appointment (Rule 020205).

questions.question: If an officer refuses a legitimate transfer order from the appropriate authority, they may be liable for:
questions.explanation: An officer who refuses transfer may be liable for disciplinary action (Rule 020208).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a recognized method by which a vacancy can occur in the Federal Civil Service?
questions.explanation: Vacancy occurs through retirement, resignation, dismissal, death, transfer, voluntary retirement, retrenchment, or expiry of contract. Special assignment does not create a vacancy.

questions.question: An officer on promotion to a grade level that does not overlap his old grade level shall be placed at which point of the new grade level?
options: The incremental point next higher than his former emolument
questions.explanation: If the Officer is promoted to a grade level that does not overlap his old grade level, he will be placed at the minimum point of his new salary grade level (Rule 040104(i)).

questions.question: When an Officer is promoted in the ordinary course, the emoluments rule applies, EXCEPT in the case of a promotion from:
options: A non-pensionable to a pensionable office
questions.explanation: Except in a case of a promotion from a non-pensionable to a pensionable office, the rules shall apply where an officer is promoted in the ordinary course within Federal Public Service (Rule 040104).

questions.question: Which section of the PSR dictates that all promotion consideration shall be in accordance with guidelines set out by the Federal Civil Service Commission?
questions.explanation: The consideration governing all promotions shall be in accordance with the guidelines set out by the Federal Civil Service Commission (Regulation No. 4(a)).

questions.question: The date on which an officer begins to earn emoluments is the date of:
questions.explanation: On first appointment, emolument shall, as a general rule be paid as from the date of assumption of duty (Rule 040102).

questions.question: What is the consequence for a Parastatal's promotion structure if it contains inconsistencies with the Public Service Rules?
options: The matter is referred to the National Assembly.
The internal rules are voided entirely.
questions.explanation: Parastatals‚Äô internal rules, procedures and practices must ensure there are no inconsistencies with the general principles contained in the Public Service Rules. In the absence of internal rules... the relevant provisions of the Public Service Rules shall apply (Rule 170104).

questions.question: Where retired Officers from the Service are re-engaged, their remuneration shall be based on:
options: The salary of the Permanent Secretary
Negotiable terms by the parties concerned
The grade level immediately below that on which they retired
The highest pay they received prior to retirement
questions.explanation: The remuneration of non-Public/Civil Servants shall be based on negotiable terms by the parties concerned (Rule 020412).

questions.question: For a senior staff officer appointed to the Foreign Service, confirmation of appointment is based on successful completion of the required grades of Foreign Service Academy Course, which the Officer must attend within how many years of his employment?
questions.explanation: Confirmation of a Foreign Affairs Officer shall be based on the successful completion of the required grades of Foreign Service Academy Course, which the Officer must attend within two years of his employment.
questions.chapter: Chapter 18 ‚Äì Confirmation of Foreign Service Officer

questions.question: An officer may voluntarily retire from the service after attaining what minimum number of years of pensionable service?
questions.explanation: Voluntary Retirement is permissible after 10 years of service (Rule 020809).

questions.question: Transfer is defined as the permanent release of an Officer from one Scheduled Service to another or from one class to another within the same Service. True or False?
questions.explanation: Transfer means the permanent release of an Officer from one Scheduled Service to another or from one class to another within the same Service (Rule 020501(a)).

questions.question: If an officer on secondment is eligible for promotion, which organization retains the responsibility for handling the promotion process?
options: The Federal Civil Service Commission directly
questions.explanation: The parent organization retains responsibility for all personnel matters including promotion during secondment (Rule 020504, 020807).

questions.question: Promotion to all posts in the Federal Civil Service other than those of Permanent Secretaries are vested in:
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation
questions.explanation: Promotion to all posts in the Federal Civil Service other than those of Permanent Secretaries are vested in the Federal Civil Service Commission (Rule 020801(a)).

questions.question: Who must approve the immediate return of an officer who previously resigned or was dismissed from the public service, if re-applying for employment?
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation
questions.explanation: Such approval must always be obtained irrespective of any delegation of the Commission‚Äôs powers (Rule 020206(ii)).

questions.question: What is the maximum number of years an officer in the Foreign Service can serve on a normal tour of duty abroad?
questions.explanation: The period of a normal tour of duty abroad shall be 4 years but Government reserves the right to recall the officer at any time (Regulation 26 (2)).
questions.chapter: Chapter 18 ‚Äì Foreign Service Tour of Duty

questions.question: If an officer's emolument in the former post is higher than the minimum point of the new grade level upon promotion, where is the officer placed?
options: At the minimum point of the new grade level
At the incremental point next higher than his former emolument
At the incremental point corresponding to their old grade step
At the maximum point of the new grade level
questions.explanation: He will be placed on the next point, higher than his former emolument after taking into consideration the increment he would have earned if he had not been promoted (Rule 040104(ii)).

questions.question: Who has the authority to approve appointments and promotions for junior staff (GL.06 and below) in the Ministry/Extra-Ministerial Office?
options: The Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office
The Junior Staff Committees of the MDA
questions.explanation: The responsibility for promotion of Officers into GL.06 or its equivalent and below shall be by the Ministry/Department & Agency (Rule 020802(e)(i)). Appointments at this level are decentralized to Junior Staff Committees.

questions.question: When an acting officer hands over to the substantive holder, the gazetted date of cessation of the acting appointment shall be:
options: The date the acting appointment was approved
The date of the gazette notice reverting the officer‚Äôs appointment
The date the substantive holder takes over the duties
The end of the current month
questions.explanation: The gazetted date of cessation will be that on which the acting Officer relinquishes the duties and responsibilities of the post, except that if he hands over to the substantive holder, the gazetted date of cessation will not normally be later than the date on which the latter takes over (Rule 020706).

questions.question: For an officer to be considered for promotion, the officer must have undergone the required:
questions.explanation: An Officer shall undergo structured training and achieve skill competence required by his Scheme of Service before he can be considered for promotion (Rule 020803(a)).

questions.question: The general principles of promotion require that seniority and previous records of performance shall be taken into account in choosing between candidates with equal potential for promotion. True or False?
questions.explanation: Seniority and previous records of performance will be taken into account in choosing between candidates with equal potential for promotion (Rule 020802(d)(ii)).

questions.question: The process of recruitment, defined as the filling of vacancies by direct appointment, explicitly excludes:
options: Transfer of officers from other Public Service in the Federation to the Federal Public Service
questions.explanation: Recruitment... excludes the transfer of officers from other Public Service in the Federation to the Federal Public Service (Rule 020201).

questions.question: If an officer who is entitled to promotion sits for promotion examination while on an approved secondment, what is the effect if successful?
options: The promotion is notional until return from secondment.
The officer must forfeit the secondment immediately.
questions.explanation: Seconded officers can sit promotion exams to avoid stagnation and ensure career progression while away, and the promotion is effective immediately.

questions.question: The authority responsible for the conduct and supervision of the Compulsory Confirmation/Promotion Examination is the:
options: Career Management Office (CMO) in the OHCSF
questions.explanation: It is the responsibility of the Career Management Office (CMO) in the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation to conduct and supervise the examination (Rule 030102).

questions.question: Who must approve the appointment of Principal Representatives of Nigeria abroad (Ambassadors, High Commissioners)?
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation
questions.explanation: The power to appoint Ambassadors, High Commissioners, and Heads of Missions... is vested in the President on the advice of the Minister of Foreign Affairs (Regulation No. 4(1)(a)).

questions.question: What is the consequence if an officer appointed directly to the Foreign Service fails to pass the Foreign Service Academy Course after two (2) attempts?
options: They are demoted one grade level.
They must transfer to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Headquarters.
They proceed on compulsory study leave.
questions.explanation: Officers who fail to pass the Foreign Service Academy Course after two (2) attempts shall have their appointment terminated.

questions.question: Who ensures compliance when an Officer fails the compulsory confirmation examination after three consecutive attempts and is required to resign?
options: The Permanent Secretary (CMO) Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation
The Director of Human Resources of the MDA
questions.explanation: The Permanent Secretary (CMO) Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation shall ensure compliance (Rule 030104).
questions.chapter: Chapter 3 ‚Äì Failure to Pass Confirmation Examination

questions.question: What is the rule regarding the re-absorption of an officer after mandatory retirement?
options: Permitted if the officer is below 65 years of age.
questions.explanation: No Officer shall be allowed to remain in Service after attaining the retirement age of 60 years or 35 years of pensionable Service whichever is earlier (Rule 020908(ii)).

questions.question: What is the maximum period in years for which an officer must take the compulsory confirmation examination after taking up their appointment?
questions.explanation: All officers must take the confirmation examination within two years from the date of taking up their appointments (Rule 030105).
questions.chapter: Chapter 3 ‚Äì Failure to Take Confirmation Examination

questions.question: What is the typical minimum number of years an officer must spend on GL 15‚Äì17 before being considered for promotion?
questions.explanation: For Grade Levels 15‚Äì17, the minimum period in post before consideration for promotion is 4 years (Rule 020802(c)).
questions.chapter: Chapter 2 ‚Äì Minimum Years in Post for Promotion

questions.question: Who is responsible for compiling a list of all eligible candidates before each promotion examination?
options: The appropriate Office in the MDA
questions.explanation: Before each promotion exercise, the appropriate Office shall compile a list of all eligible candidates to be considered (Rule 020803).

subcategories.name: Discipline & Misconduct
subcategories.description: Rules defining General Inefficiency, Misconduct, Serious Misconduct, disciplinary measures, and process of appeals (Chapter 10, 11).

questions.question: Which of the following disciplinary measures is NOT permitted under the Public Service Rules (PSR)?
options: Fines or penalties related to debt
questions.explanation: Disciplinary measures include dismissal, reduction in rank/salary, withholding/deferment of increment, loss of pay for unauthorized absence, surcharge, reprimand, or warnings. Fines are generally prohibited (Rule 100309).

questions.question: What is the penalty for an Officer who is absent from duty without leave?
options: Loss of pay for the period of absence
questions.explanation: The disciplinary measures include loss of pay non-payment for the corresponding days an Officer is not at his duty post/station without authority (Rule 100801(v)).

questions.question: The ultimate penalty for serious misconduct is:
questions.explanation: Serious misconduct is a specified act of very serious wrong doing... which if proven, may lead to dismissal (Rule 100401).

questions.question: General Inefficiency is defined as:
options: A single, massive error leading to financial loss
A failure to achieve promotion in two consecutive attempts
Persistent omission or incompetence that hampers effective duty performance
Refusal to obey a legitimate instruction
questions.explanation: General Inefficiency is defined as: Persistent omission or incompetence that hampers effective duty performance (Rule 100203).

questions.question: What is the mandatory first step in the disciplinary procedure for misconduct?
options: Issuance of a written query and request for explanation
questions.explanation: The disciplinary procedure starts with the issuance of a query and request for explanation (Rule 100302).

questions.question: Who is the disciplinary authority for Officers on Salary Grade Level (GL) 06 and below?
options: The Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Department
The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
questions.explanation: Permanent Secretaries and Heads of Extra-Ministerial Departments have delegated disciplinary powers for officers on Salary Grade Levels (GL) 13 and below, limited to dismissal for GL 06 and below (Rule 100103).

questions.question: Which of these acts is classified as Serious Misconduct?
options: Absence from duty without leave (less than 14 days)
questions.explanation: Acts of Serious Misconduct include Falsification of records (Rule 100402(a)).

questions.question: An officer who is absent from duty without leave for a period of fourteen (14) consecutive days may be deemed to have:
questions.explanation: Absence without leave for 14 consecutive days may be construed as resignation from the service (Rule 030413).

questions.question: When an Officer is interdicted, what percentage of their annual salary do they receive?
questions.explanation: Interdiction involves temporary removal from duty with a reduction in salary (half pay) pending investigation (Rule 030405).

questions.question: If an officer is placed on suspension pending the conclusion of an investigation into gross misconduct (Rule 030406), what is the salary status?
questions.explanation: Suspension (Rule 030406) removes the officer from duty without pay pending investigation, which differs from interdiction (Rule 030405).

questions.question: Disciplinary proceedings against a female staff who might otherwise have been disciplined before proceeding on maternity leave shall be postponed until:
options: The officer has provided a written defense
The child reaches six months of age
questions.explanation: Any disciplinary proceedings against a female staff which might otherwise have been taken during the period of her maternity leave shall be postponed until the leave has expired (Rule 100306).

questions.question: An Officer who is dismissed from service forfeits all claims to retiring benefits, leave or transport grant, subject to the provisions of which primary legislation?
options: The Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, 1999
questions.explanation: Dismissal results in forfeiture of all pension rights and benefits, subject to the provisions of the Pension Reform Act, 2014 (as amended) (Rule 100407).

questions.question: The disciplinary procedure for a Permanent Secretary includes a formal hearing before the Service Management Committee, and the final decision rests with:
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
questions.explanation: The final decision on the discipline of a Permanent Secretary rests with the President (Rule 100702(v)).
questions.chapter: Chapter 10 ‚Äì Discipline Procedure for Permanent Secretaries

questions.question: An officer aggrieved by a disciplinary decision may petition or appeal through the proper channels as described in:
questions.explanation: Aggrieved officers can petition decisions through the proper channels as described in Chapter 11.

questions.question: If an officer is found guilty of misconduct and receives punishment (Rule 100304), they must be informed:
options: In writing and be required to acknowledge receipt in writing
questions.explanation: The Officer shall be required to acknowledge its receipt in writing (Rule 100302).

questions.question: Which body is the disciplinary authority for Directors (GL 17) in the Federal Civil Service?
questions.explanation: The Civil Service Commission is the disciplinary authority for Directors (GL 17) (Rule 110102).

questions.question: If an officer's misconduct is brought to the notice of their superior, the superior Officer shall report it immediately to:
questions.explanation: The superior Officer is to report it through the HOD to the Director Human Resource (Rule 100404(b)).

questions.question: An officer may withdraw their resignation before:
options: The expiry of the notice period
Formal acceptance by the appropriate authority
The date of the gazette publication
The completion of the exit interview
questions.explanation: Resignation may be withdrawn at any time before formal acceptance by the appropriate authority (Rule 020904).

questions.question: The disciplinary authority for a junior officer (GL 06 and below) in a parastatal is primarily the:
options: Chief Executive Officer on recommendation of the Junior Staff Committee
questions.explanation: Junior staff promotions are approved by CEOs on JSC recommendation. Disciplinary control is exercised by Staff Committees, with Board/Council approval for GL 07+ (Rule 170305).

questions.question: Which of these is explicitly classified as Serious Misconduct?
questions.explanation: Serious Misconduct includes engaging in partisan political activities (Rule 100402(g)).

questions.question: An officer cannot appeal a disciplinary decision if:
options: It deals with reduction in rank
It deals with a case in which legal action is pending in a Court of Law
It was issued by the Permanent Secretary
The punishment is a written warning
questions.explanation: An appeal/petition will not be entertained if it deals with a case in which legal action is pending in a Court of Law (Rule 110208(a)(ii)).

questions.question: If an officer refuses to reply to allegations made against them by a Tribunal of Inquiry, the Federal Civil Service Commission/Board may proceed to:
options: Accept and enforce the recommendation of the Tribunal of Inquiry
Transfer the officer to a remote station
questions.explanation: If the Officer refuses or neglects to reply to the allegations... the Federal Civil Service Commission/Board or its agent shall proceed to accept and enforce the recommendation of the Tribunal of Inquiry and take such disciplinary action as it deems appropriate (Rule 100303).

questions.question: What happens if a Tribunal of Inquiry's recommendation is not considered serious enough to warrant proceedings under Rule 100307?
options: The FCSC must dismiss the officer immediately.
The FCSC may cause an investigation to be made into the matter.
The officer is given a letter of commendation.
questions.explanation: If it is presented to the Federal Civil Service Commission that an officer has been found guilty of misconduct and the Commission does not consider the alleged misconduct serious enough... it may cause an investigation to be made into the matter in such a manner as it considers proper (Rule 100305).

questions.question: The disciplinary procedure for misconduct involving a Permanent Secretary is initiated by drawing the attention of which official to the infractions?
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
questions.explanation: When a Permanent Secretary is alleged to have committed a misconduct, the duty is to draw the attention of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation to the infractions (Rule 100701).

questions.question: For an officer facing serious allegations, what right do they have regarding evidence during disciplinary proceedings?
options: The right to refuse evidence disclosure
The right to be given access to any document(s) or report(s) used against them
The right to appeal directly to the President without hearing
questions.explanation: In serious cases which are likely to result in dismissal, the Officer should be given access to any document(s) or report(s) used against him and he should be asked to state in his defence that he has been given access to documents (Rule 100307(i)).

questions.question: If an officer is dismissed, the effective date of the dismissal is the date on which he is served with the notification. True or False?
questions.explanation: Dismissal shall take effect from the date on which he is served with the notification (Rule 100408).

questions.question: Misconduct is defined as improper behavior that:
options: Only occurs during official working hours
Is generally confined to minor technical infractions
Undermines the image of the service
Results in financial loss exceeding N50,000
questions.explanation: Misconduct is improper behavior that undermines the image of the service (Rule 100301).

questions.question: In the disciplinary procedure, the Officer facing allegations has the right to:
options: Legal representation and cross-examination of witnesses
Immediate transfer to a new post
Full pay during the suspension period
questions.explanation: Officers facing disciplinary action have the right to legal representation and cross-examination of witnesses.

questions.question: When can an officer tender their resignation from service?
options: During ongoing disciplinary proceedings for serious misconduct.
Only after completing a mandatory exit interview.
Any time, provided they give one month's notice.
Any time before formal acceptance by the appropriate authority.
questions.explanation: An officer wishing to resign is required to give one month's notice in writing (Rule 020904). Resignation is not permitted during disciplinary proceedings (Rule 020904, Rule 8.12).

questions.question: If an officer is reinstated after interdiction, is the service period during interdiction generally restored?
options: Yes, the service period may be restored.
Only half the period is restored.
questions.explanation: If exonerated, service period during interdiction may be restored (Rule 030410).

questions.question: Which specific body in a Ministry/Extra-Ministerial Office handles disciplinary matters for officers on GL 07 and above?
questions.explanation: The Senior Staff Committee oversees decisions on officers GL07 and above, including disciplinary cases.

questions.question: If a disciplinary case proceeds to a formal hearing before a Board of Inquiry, what is the minimum required membership of that Board?
questions.explanation: Allegations of misconduct are generally investigated by a board of inquiry with at least three members (Rule 100308(v)).

questions.question: What is the penalty for falsification of official records?
questions.explanation: Falsification of official records leads to dismissal from service (Rule 100401).

questions.question: What happens if an officer tenders resignation during ongoing disciplinary proceedings for serious misconduct?
options: The process is halted pending ministerial review.
The officer is transferred to a non-sensitive post.
questions.explanation: The disciplinary process continues despite resignation if serious allegations are involved (Rule 020904, Rule 8.49).

questions.question: An appeal against dismissal must be filed within how many days of receiving the dismissal letter?
questions.explanation: An appeal against dismissal must be filed within 30 days of receiving the dismissal letter (Rule 8.14).

questions.question: If an officer is convicted of a criminal offense, other than a minor traffic or sanitary offense, this constitutes:
questions.explanation: Conviction on a criminal charge (other than a minor traffic or sanitary offense or the like) is an act of Serious Misconduct (Rule 100402(d)).

questions.question: If a Permanent Secretary fails to furnish any representation on an allegation of misconduct within the specified timeframe, who may forward the query and the representation to the Federal Service Management Committee?
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
questions.explanation: Should the Permanent Secretary fail to furnish any representation within the time fixed, the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation may forward the query, and the representation to the Federal Service Management Committee (Rule 100702(iii)).

questions.question: In cases of minor offenses, the disciplinary procedure often concludes with what type of punishment?
questions.explanation: Minor offenses may be handled through verbal or written warnings without formal inquiry.

questions.question: If an officer attempts to take legal action against the government concerning their service matters without obtaining the necessary approval from the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF), what immediate administrative action must be taken?
options: The officer is transferred to the Ministry of Justice.
questions.explanation: Legal action without compliance with PSR leads to suspension pending the outcome (Rule 110202(iii)).

questions.question: The right to appeal against disciplinary decisions is vested in:
options: Any officer aggrieved by a disciplinary decision
Officers with over 10 years of service
questions.explanation: Any officer aggrieved by a disciplinary decision may appeal (Chapter 11).

questions.question: The disciplinary measure 'Reduction in Rank' falls under which type of sanction?
questions.explanation: Reduction in rank is listed among the disciplinary measures that may be taken under the guidelines (Rule 100702(ii)).

questions.question: When an officer is facing allegations of misconduct, who has the right to invite witnesses to defend the officer during a hearing?
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation
questions.explanation: The officer... shall be entitled to invite witnesses (Rule 100702(iii)).

questions.question: An officer may be dismissed during probation:
options: With a simplified process compared to confirmed officers
questions.explanation: Dismissal during probation follows a simplified process compared to confirmed officers.

questions.question: What happens if an officer successfully appeals their dismissal?
options: They are reinstated but without full arrears of salary.
They are reinstated and entitled to full arrears of salary.
questions.explanation: An officer who is reinstated after successful appeal is entitled to full arrears of salary for the period of interdiction/suspension.

questions.question: If an officer is dismissed for misconduct, can they be re-employed in the Federal Public Service at a later date?
options: No, dismissal generally disqualifies future employment.
Yes, only in a different capacity.
questions.explanation: Dismissal for misconduct generally disqualifies an officer from future public service employment.

questions.question: Who must approve the implementation of disciplinary action against officers on GL 07‚Äì14 within a Ministry/Extra-Ministerial Office?
questions.explanation: Disciplinary control over officers on GL 07 and above is vested in the FCSC.

questions.question: If a Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office decides to impose or recommend deferment or withholding of increment (Rule 040204), they must take into account:
options: The financial stability of the MDA
The gravity of the shortcoming and the quality of the officer's previous service
questions.explanation: The Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office will take into account the gravity of the shortcoming and the quality of the Officer‚Äôs previous service (Rule 040204).

questions.question: An appeal regarding appointments or promotions should be addressed to:
options: The Permanent Secretary of the MDA
The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
The Chairman, Federal Civil Service Commission
questions.explanation: Appeals on appointments or promotions should be addressed to the Chairman, Federal Civil Service Commission (Rule 110102(a)).

questions.question: When an Officer has been suspended, what is the maximum recommended duration for the suspension, after which reinstatement with full pay must be considered?
questions.explanation: Suspension should not exceed three months pending investigation (Rule 11.37). If interdiction exceeds 6 months, the officer must be reinstated with full pay pending conclusion (Rule 11.15).

questions.question: The term 'Surcharge' is a disciplinary measure that involves:
options: Recovery of government losses from officer's pay
Reduction in rank for one year
Payment of a fixed fine determined by the Minister
questions.explanation: Surcharge is the recovery of government losses from officer's pay, applied when loss is due to officer‚Äôs fault (Rule 100310).

subcategories.name: Leave, Absence & Holidays
subcategories.description: Rules on annual leave, sick leave, maternity/paternity leave, study leave, sabbatical leave, and unauthorized absence (Chapter 12).

questions.question: What is the annual leave entitlement for an officer on Grade Level 07 and above?
questions.explanation: Annual Leave entitlement is 30 working days for GL07 and above (Rule 120203).

questions.question: The public service leave year runs from:
options: Date of first appointment to 12 months later
questions.explanation: The standard leave year in the public service runs from January 1 to December 31 (Rule 120106).

questions.question: The deferment of annual leave is:
options: Allowed for a maximum of 30 days
Permitted if approved by the Minister
questions.explanation: Deferment of annual leave is abolished (Rule 120106).

questions.question: What is the maximum duration for maternity leave granted to female officers?
questions.explanation: Maternity leave duration is 16 weeks (Rule 120218).

questions.question: What is the duration of paternity leave granted to male officers whose spouses have delivered a baby?
questions.explanation: Paternity leave is granted for 14 working days (Rule 120219).

questions.question: The maximum period for sick leave granted with full pay to an officer (before requiring a Medical Board review) is:
questions.explanation: Sick leave with full pay may be granted for up to 6 months. After 90 days, the Medical Board reviews the case (Rule 130319).

questions.question: An officer may be granted special leave with full pay on compassionate grounds for up to two weeks for:
questions.explanation: An Officer may be allowed special leave up to two weeks for burial of spouse/child/parents/parents of spouse (Rule 120233).

questions.question: What is the maximum number of working days that may be taken as casual leave annually?
questions.explanation: Casual leave should not exceed seven days in any calendar year (Rule 120215).

questions.question: An officer on sabbatical leave may NOT be granted notional promotion. However, they are eligible to sit for promotion interview/examinations at:
options: The Nigerian Embassy in their location
questions.explanation: Officer on sabbatical leave shall not be granted notional promotion. However, such Officer shall be eligible to sit for promotion interview/examinations at the nearest designated centers (Rule 120224(f)).

questions.question: The period of sabbatical leave shall be for a period of twelve (12) calendar months once in how many years?
questions.explanation: The leave shall be for a period of twelve (12) calendar months once in five (5) years (Rule 120223).

questions.question: What is the maximum duration for which Study Leave with pay may be granted, including any possible extension?
questions.explanation: The maximum duration of study leave with pay shall not exceed two years, extendable by one year (Rule 120228).

questions.question: The duration of Study Leave without pay shall not be regarded as a break in service. True or False?
questions.explanation: The period of study leave without pay shall not be regarded as a break in service (Rule 120230(b)).

questions.question: To whom should an officer submit the formal report on academic/administrative work accomplished upon returning from Sabbatical leave?
options: The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
The National Institute for Policy and Strategic Studies (NIPSS)
questions.explanation: All Officers returning from sabbatical leave must submit a formal report on academic/administrative work accomplished during the leave period (Rule 120224(e)).

questions.question: Leave of Absence is generally defined as:
options: A temporary transfer to a different unit
Authorized absence from duty for a specific period
Unpaid long-term leave granted for special cases
questions.explanation: Leave of Absence (Rule 120234, 120238) is often described as unpaid long-term leave.

questions.question: Which specific condition must be certified by the Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office for an officer to be granted leave for a non-compulsory examination with full pay?
options: That the officer has passed the confirmation exam
That the passing of the examination is likely to enhance his value to the Service
That the officer has served for at least five years
questions.explanation: The Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office certifies... that the passing of the examination is likely to enhance his value to the Service (Rule 120222(a)).

questions.question: An officer returning from any leave period must complete a:
questions.explanation: Upon returning from any leave or transfer, officers must complete a Duty Resumption Form (Practice-based).

questions.question: An officer must complete how many months of leave-earning service after their last leave to qualify for annual leave again?
questions.explanation: Completion of six months of leave earning service qualifies an officer for annual leave.

questions.question: An officer on leave may not engage in any gainful employment without obtaining approval, as this violates:
questions.explanation: An Officer on leave of absence shall not accept any paid employment without previously obtaining the express approval from the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (Rule 120235).

questions.question: What is the maximum period of leave without pay that may be granted to the spouse of a serving Officer proceeding on posting abroad, provided the spouse uses this time to acquire additional qualifications?
options: Four years in the first instance
questions.explanation: The period the spouse can be on leave of absence shall be four years in the first instance and subject to an extension of not more than one year (Rule 120239(d)).
questions.chapter: Chapter 12 ‚Äì Spouse Leave on Grounds of Public Policy

questions.question: An officer who leaves the Service, other than by dismissal, during a leave year may be required to:
options: Refund salary paid in excess of what he was eligible to receive
Pay a penalty equivalent to one month's salary
questions.explanation: If an officer leaves the Service, other than by dismissal... during a leave year, he will be required to refund salary paid in excess of what he was eligible to receive (Rule 020905). (Note: Although Rule 020905 is related to retirement on health grounds, it is often interpreted to apply to all exits regarding leave refunds).
questions.chapter: Chapter 2 ‚Äì Exiting Service During Leave Year

questions.question: What kind of leave is granted to an officer proceeding on retirement?
questions.explanation: An officer may take pre-retirement leave (Terminal Leave).

questions.question: If an officer is required to proceed on an authorized journey in the service of the Government, what type of absence is this classified as?
questions.explanation: An officer is on duty when at their official station or on any authorized journey in the service of the government.

questions.question: For an officer nursing a child, what is the maximum duration for the granted two hours off-duty every day?
questions.explanation: This facility is granted up to a maximum period of six months from the date she resumes duty from maternity leave (Rule 120220).
questions.chapter: Chapter 12 ‚Äì Time off for Nursing Mothers

questions.question: An officer may be granted special leave for the purpose of taking a compulsory examination, provided the passing of the examination is a condition of:
questions.explanation: An Officer may be granted special leave for the purpose of taking an examination, which he is required to pass by the condition of services of his appointment (Rule 120221).

questions.question: The granting of leave for religious pilgrimage is typically limited to:
options: Annually, if taken from annual leave
As approved by the religious body
questions.explanation: Leave for religious pilgrimage may be granted once during an officer's service lifetime (Rule 14.29).

questions.question: Can an officer be recalled from approved leave before the scheduled end date?
options: Yes, if service exigencies demand it, by the Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office.
Yes, only by the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation.
No, unless the officer is facing disciplinary action.
questions.explanation: Officers can be recalled from leave if service exigencies demand it, by the Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office (Rule 120210).

questions.question: What is the maximum number of working days that are allowed for pre-retirement leave?
questions.explanation: Pre-retirement leave is granted for a maximum of 90 working days (Rule 120243).

questions.question: If an officer is required to transport their motor vehicle for repair due to lack of adequate facilities at their station, who grants the necessary authority?
options: The Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office
questions.explanation: The Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office may allow transport for his motor vehicle or part thereof and from the nearest place where such facilities exist, for the purpose of effecting necessary repairs (Rule 080205).
questions.chapter: Chapter 8 ‚Äì Transport of Motor Vehicle for Repair

questions.question: What is the purpose of granting leave without pay to the spouse of a serving officer posting abroad (Rule 120239)?
options: To allow the spouse to take up gainful employment abroad
To allow the spouse to acquire additional qualifications which enhance their usefulness to the Service
To enable the spouse to apply for a transfer to the Foreign Service
To compensate for the disruption of service life
questions.explanation: One of the conditions is that such spouses improve themselves by acquiring additional qualifications, which enhance their usefulness to the Service (Rule 120239(c)).

questions.question: If an officer on sick leave requires absence beyond the six months of full pay entitlement, subsequent sick leave may be granted:
options: With full pay for another six months
With half pay for a maximum of twelve months
With no pay, pending medical retirement review
Only upon immediate return to duty
questions.explanation: Sick leave beyond 6 months requires a Medical Board and usually leads to retirement if fitness is not restored. Subsequent periods are often without pay.

questions.question: The period of study leave without pay shall not exceed four years in the first instance, after which the Officer can apply for:
options: An extension of not more than one year
Permanent transfer to the overseas country
questions.explanation: The duration of study leave without pay shall not be more than four years in the first instance, after which the Officer can apply for one-year extension if the need arises (Rule 120230(a)).
questions.chapter: Chapter 12 ‚Äì Study Leave Without Pay Duration

questions.question: Officers going on religious pilgrimages other than officials assigned to cover such activities should use part of their:
questions.explanation: Officers going on religious pilgrimages other than Officials assigned to cover such activities should use part of their annual leave for such purposes (Rule 120232).

questions.question: What happens if a female officer undertaking a training course of not more than six months duration interrupts the course due to pregnancy?
options: She automatically transfers to maternity leave.
She may be required to enter into an agreement to refund the whole or part of the cost of the course.
The MDA sponsors her spouse for the remaining duration.
questions.explanation: A female Officer who is about to undertake a course of training of not more than six months duration shall be called upon to enter into an agreement to refund the whole or part of the cost of the course in the event of her course being interrupted on grounds of pregnancy (Rule 070210).

questions.question: Which specific days are excluded when calculating 'working days' for leave purposes?
questions.explanation: Annual and other types of leave exclude weekends and public holidays (Rule 120247‚Äì120248).

questions.question: Officers who are members of trade unions may be granted leave for trade union activities, the maximum period being:
options: As approved by the appropriate authority
questions.explanation: Leave for trade union activities may be granted as approved by the appropriate authority (Rule 6.23).

questions.question: Leave granted for the purpose of taking an examination (compulsory or non-compulsory) is known as:
questions.explanation: An officer may be allowed special leave to take an examination (Rule 120221, 120222). The maximum period for examination leave is 2 weeks.

questions.question: Which type of leave does Rule 120235 prohibit an officer from engaging in paid employment during?
questions.explanation: An Officer on leave of absence shall not accept any paid employment without previously obtaining the express approval from the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (Rule 120235).

questions.question: The period of pre-retirement leave must be taken:
options: Any time within the last two years of service
Only after the officer has received their first pension payment
questions.explanation: Pre-retirement leave is typically taken 3 months before retirement.

questions.question: Who must approve the release of any officer on study leave without pay?
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
questions.explanation: The release of any Officer on study leave shall be subject to the approval of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (Rule 120231).
questions.chapter: Chapter 12 ‚Äì Approval to Proceed on Study Leave

questions.question: If an officer is required to take sick leave, the leave must be certified by:
questions.explanation: Sick leave is granted due to illness, certified by an approved medical practitioner (Rule 120216).

questions.question: What consequence may an officer face if they overstay their approved leave without permission?
questions.explanation: If an officer overstays approved leave, they may be subject to disciplinary action (Rule 120213).

questions.question: What is the maximum period for which an officer may be granted Leave of Absence for Special/Personal Assistant on grounds of public policy?
questions.explanation: Leave of Absence on grounds of public policy... and Leave of Absence for Special/Personal Assistant on grounds of public policy (Rule 120236). These types of leave are usually long-term and determined by the tenure of the principal officer.
questions.chapter: Chapter 12 ‚Äì Types of Leave of Absence

questions.question: Which of these categories of political appointments shall Leave of Absence NOT cover?
options: Secretary to the Government of the Federation
Appointments to the Federal Civil Service Commission
questions.explanation: Leave of Absence shall not cover such appointments as: Secretary to Government of the Federation, Ministers, Secretary to State Government, Commissioners, or any other Political Appointment (Rule 120237). FCSC appointments are career/constitutional, not covered under this political leave category.
questions.chapter: Chapter 12 ‚Äì Leave of Absence not to Cover Political Appointments

questions.question: An officer returning from sabbatical leave must work for Government for a minimum period of before exiting Service:
questions.explanation: Upon an Officer‚Äôs return from sabbatical leave, he must work for Government for a period of one year before exiting from Service (Rule 120224(g)).

questions.question: If an officer is required to take sick leave, and the illness is confirmed by a Medical Board as being caused by their own misconduct (e.g., drunkenness), the officer may be granted:
questions.explanation: If the Medical Board determines the illness resulted from the officer's misconduct, the leave is typically without pay.

questions.question: The submission of the leave roster in MDAs should be prepared and maintained:
questions.explanation: Leave rosters must be prepared and maintained quarterly.

questions.question: An officer who is a public servant shall be permitted to join his spouse proceeding abroad on a course of instruction if the course duration is not less than:
questions.explanation: An Officer who is also a public servant shall be permitted to join his spouse proceeding abroad on a course of instruction where the course of instruction is not less than nine (9) months (Rule 120238).
questions.chapter: Chapter 12 ‚Äì Leave of Absence to Join Spouse on Course

questions.question: Which of the following bodies must sanction any period of sick leave exceeding 90 days?
questions.explanation: Sick leave beyond 90 days must be referred to a Medical Board (Rule 130319).

questions.question: Study leave is the leave granted to a confirmed serving Officer to undertake an approved course of study, which may be:
options: Only for courses lasting less than six months
questions.explanation: Study leave is the leave granted to a confirmed serving Officer to undertake an approved course of study within or outside the country (Rule 120225).

questions.question: An officer must obtain approval from their supervisor before proceeding on leave and before traveling outside their station on duty. True or False?
questions.explanation: Officers must obtain permission before proceeding on leave and before traveling outside their station on duty (Rule 3.5).

subcategories.name: Allowances, Pay & Benefits
subcategories.description: Rules on salary, increments, acting allowance, DTA, Estacode, terminal benefits, and pension (Chapter 4, 8, 9, 13, 14).

questions.question: The authority that contains guidance on the payment of emoluments and wages is the:
questions.explanation: Financial Regulations contain guidance on the payment of emoluments and wages (Rule 040101).

questions.question: An officer performing the duties of a higher office is entitled to Acting Allowance after serving in that capacity for a minimum of:
questions.explanation: Acting appointment... allowance due after 30 days (Rule 070206).

questions.question: What is the frequency of payment for the Furniture Grant to eligible officers?
questions.explanation: Furniture grant is payable once every three years to eligible officers (Rule 9.6).

questions.question: What percentage of their basic salary do Permanent Secretaries receive as Responsibility Allowance?
questions.explanation: Permanent secretaries receive responsibility allowance equivalent to 50% of their basic salary (Rule 9.26).

questions.question: The Leave Transport Grant is payable:
options: Before the officer proceeds on annual leave
questions.explanation: Leave Transport Grant is payable before an officer proceeds on annual leave (Rule 4.20, 9.22, 4.49).

questions.question: If an officer incurs a financial loss to the Government due to disregarding standing orders or neglect of duty, the amount deducted from their salary (surcharge) shall be fixed by:
options: The Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office
The Director of Finance and Accounts
questions.explanation: The amount... shall be fixed by his Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office (Rule 021211).
questions.chapter: Chapter 2 ‚Äì Liability to Make Good Damage

questions.question: An officer on transfer is entitled to transportation of personal effects and travel allowance for themselves and up to how many recognized dependent family members?
questions.explanation: Transfer benefits cover the officer and up to four recognized family members (Rule 5.15).
questions.chapter: Chapter 5 ‚Äì Family Member Coverage on Transfer

questions.question: What is the nature of the Medical Allowance paid to officers in the Federal Public Service?
options: A fixed monthly amount paid regardless of actual expenses
questions.explanation: Medical allowance is a fixed monthly amount paid to all officers regardless of actual medical expenses (Rule 4.8, 9.9).

questions.question: If an officer is traveling internationally on official assignment, they can receive a travel advance equivalent to what percentage of estimated costs?
questions.explanation: Officers can receive up to 100% advance of estimated costs for international official travel (Rule 5.9).

questions.question: The mandatory retirement age for academics (University staff) is an exception to the PSR Rule 020908, being:
questions.explanation: The provision... is without prejudice to prevailing conditions of service for Judicial Officers, Academic Staff of Universities and other Officers whose retirement age is at variance with (i) and (ii) above (Rule 020908(iii)). The generally accepted standard for academic staff is 70 years.

questions.question: An Officer appointed to a new post or promoted receives their first annual increment on the 1st January of the year following at least how many months of service or promotion?
questions.explanation: The incremental date of an Officer appointed or promoted to a post in the Federal Public Service shall be $1^{st}$ January of the year following at least six months of service or promotion (Rule 040203).

questions.question: What is the maximum gratuity payable to an officer upon retirement, according to general pension rules?
questions.explanation: Gratuity payment is capped at 300% of the officer's annual emolument.

questions.question: What allowance is payable to officers posted to a rural area?
questions.explanation: Officers posted to rural areas receive 20% of their basic salary as rural posting allowance (Rule 9.4).

questions.question: What is the primary compensation provided for officers engaged in specific risk-prone duties?
questions.explanation: Hazard allowance is specifically for officers engaged in risk-prone duties (Rule 4.17, 9.5).

questions.question: The responsibility for processing salary deductions (including pension contributions) lies with which office?
options: The Office of the Accountant General of the Federation
The Budget Office of the Federation
The National Salaries, Incomes and Wages Commission
questions.explanation: The Office of the Accountant General processes all salary deductions (Rule 4.26, 4.32).

questions.question: What term refers to the predetermined amount added to the annual emolument of an Officer every calendar year?
questions.explanation: Increment is a predetermined amount added to the annual emolument of an Officer every calendar year (Rule 040201).

questions.question: An officer traveling on official assignment outside their duty station in Nigeria is entitled to:
questions.explanation: Duty Tour Allowance (DTA) is for local official travel expenses (Rule 130206).

questions.question: An officer whose increment is deferred remains eligible for their original incremental date for subsequent increments. True or False?
questions.explanation: The recipient retains his original incremental date for subsequent increments (Rule 040205).

questions.question: If an officer fails to submit their travel account (retirement of advance) within the stipulated time, they shall face:
questions.explanation: Failure to account for travel advance within specified time constitutes a disciplinary offence (Rule 5.28).

questions.question: An officer who resigned from service before reaching retirement age (except for medical reasons or death) is generally entitled only to:
questions.explanation: Resignation before retirement age entitles officer only to contributed pension funds (Rule 8.40).

questions.question: The payment of terminal benefits must be processed promptly to ensure officers receive their funds within what maximum period of retirement?
questions.explanation: Retirement benefits shall be paid to the Officer within one month of retirement (Rule 021002).

questions.question: What is the consequence on an officer's salary progression if they are under interdiction or suspension when their annual increment is due?
options: They forfeit the increment for that year.
The increment is deferred until the 1st January of the following year.
They receive a special bonus instead.
questions.explanation: An Officer on an incremental grade level shall normally be granted an increment unless he is on interdiction/suspension or has a disciplinary action pending against him or on account of poor performance (Rule 040202).

questions.question: The responsibility for review and approval of allowances in the Federal Public Service lies with the:
options: Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
National Salaries, Incomes and Wages Commission (NSIWC)
questions.explanation: The National Salaries, Incomes and Wages Commission reviews all allowances (Rule 140101(b)).

questions.question: An officer on transfer to a new post is eligible for the emolument attached to the new office with effect from:
options: The date of the transfer approval letter
The 1st day of the next month
The date of his last promotion
questions.explanation: A staff on transfer shall be eligible for the emolument attached to his new office with effect from the date he assumes duty (Rule 040103).

questions.question: What is the maximum amount an officer can receive as mobilization fee for a contract, provided a Performance Bond is presented?
questions.explanation: Mobilization Fee [payment] up to 30% of contract sum, subject to performance bond (Section 35).

questions.question: If pension payments are delayed, the payments must include interest at the prevailing rate determined by the:
options: National Salaries, Incomes and Wages Commission (NSIWC)
questions.explanation: Delayed pension payments attract interest at the prevailing Central Bank monetary rate (Rule 7.7).

questions.question: What allowance is paid to officers on approved training courses at Federal Training Centres or Universities in Nigeria where board and lodging are NOT provided?
questions.explanation: For courses not exceeding 28 days and where board and lodging are not provided by the Training Institute, Officers shall be entitled to 50 percent (%) of their Duty Tour Allowance (Rule 140115(ii)).

questions.question: The Resettlement Allowance (Rule 140136) is paid to an officer only when:
options: They are promoted to the Directorate level
Their living conditions are disrupted due to management-initiated transfer
They transfer to a Foreign Service post
questions.explanation: Resettlement allowance is paid when living conditions are disrupted during transfer (Rule 140136). This is not payable if the officer transfers at their own request (Rule 140137).

questions.question: The minimum pension payable to an officer upon retirement is:
options: 50% of the officer's final annual salary
60% of the officer's final annual salary
80% of the officer's final annual salary
100% of the officer's final annual salary
questions.explanation: The minimum pension payable is 80% of the officer's final annual salary (Rule 7.9).

questions.question: Who is responsible for processing the payment of Leave Grant entitlements?
questions.explanation: HR department processes leave grant applications and approvals (Rule 4.34).

questions.question: Which allowance is paid once every three years and is equivalent to six months‚Äô basic salary for Permanent Secretaries?
questions.explanation: Furniture Grant is payable every three years (Rule 9.6). Permanent secretaries receive furniture grant equivalent to six months' basic salary (Rule 9.44).

questions.question: If an officer is required to serve outside Nigeria on official assignment, which allowance covers their accommodation, feeding, and incidental costs?
questions.explanation: Estacode Allowance is for foreign travel covering accommodation, feeding, and incidentals (Rule 130208).

questions.question: An officer who is on interdiction (Rule 030405) receives:
questions.explanation: An officer on interdiction receives half salary (Rule 4.13, 030405).

questions.question: The payment of promotion arrears shall be made within what specific timeframe?
options: Within the year promotion is effected
At the start of the next fiscal year
questions.explanation: Payment of promotion arrears shall be made within the year promotion is effected (Rule 040104(iii)).

questions.question: Which officer category receives Responsibility Allowance from GL 07 and above?
options: Only officers in the Inspectorate Cadre
All officers irrespective of supervisory duties
questions.explanation: Responsibility allowance is payable to officers from Grade Level 07 and above who supervise other staff (Rule 9.2).

questions.question: An officer traveling internationally on official duty, whose course duration is not less than nine months, may be accompanied by their spouse at Government expense. True or False?
questions.explanation: A senior Officer sent overseas on a course of instruction will be eligible for the air passage for himself only, but where the duration of the course of instruction is not less than nine months, his spouse may accompany him at Government expense (Rule 070206).

questions.question: What is the allowance granted to officers for expenses incurred due to working irregular or extended hours (shift duties), if they are not in the health sector?
questions.explanation: Shift duty allowance is 15% of salary for shift workers not in the health sector (Rule 140143).

questions.question: The payment of annual increments is contingent on the officer maintaining a satisfactory record and being free from disciplinary actions like interdiction, suspension, or performance issues. True or False?
questions.explanation: Increments are tied to clean service records and satisfactory performance (Rule 040202, 040203).

questions.question: The Pension Transitional Arrangement Directorate (PTAD) handles pension benefits for which group of officers?
options: Only officers in the Directorate Cadre
questions.explanation: PTAD manages pension benefits for officers who joined service before 2004 (Rule 13.13).

questions.question: What is the penalty for an officer who receives an increment deferment (Rule 040205) but does not improve performance by the end of the deferred period?
options: The deferred increment becomes forfeited entirely.
The deferred increment is suspended for another six months.
The officer is given a written warning.
The officer is transferred to a new department.
questions.explanation: If a deferred increment is not granted at or before the expiration of six months from the date it was originally due it must be withheld (Rule 040205).

questions.question: What allowance is paid to eligible drivers who have been driving vehicles incident-free for a period of not less than six months in a year?
questions.explanation: Non-accident bonus shall be paid at the rate of N50,000.00 per annum, for drivers who are not involved in an accident or whose involvement in an accident is not attributed to any faults of their own (Rule 140144).

questions.question: An officer traveling on duty (local or international) may receive cash advances, but these advances must be:
options: Retained by the officer if not fully spent
questions.explanation: Imprest [cash advance]... must be properly retired with supporting receipts.

questions.question: If an officer on secondment is compensated by the Host organization, who retains responsibility for paying the Officer‚Äôs emoluments?
options: The Office of the Accountant General
questions.explanation: During the period of such secondment, the benefiting organization shall be responsible for the Officer‚Äôs emoluments (Rule 020504).
questions.chapter: Chapter 2 ‚Äì Payment of Salary on Secondment

questions.question: What is the basis for calculating pension contributions under the Contributory Pension Scheme?
questions.explanation: Pension contributions are calculated based on total consolidated salary (Rule 7.43).

questions.question: An officer transferred at their own request is entitled to which of the following allowances?
questions.explanation: An Officer whose transfer is at his own request shall be entitled to only transport allowance and not resettlement allowance (Rule 140137).

questions.question: The term 'Pensionable Emolument' typically includes:
options: Basic salary and transport allowance only
Basic salary and housing allowance only
questions.explanation: Pensionable emolument typically comprises the total monthly salary including all approved allowances.

questions.question: An officer on study leave with pay receives:
questions.explanation: An officer on study leave with pay receives full salary and allowances.

questions.question: The retirement savings account (RSA) is managed by:
options: The Office of the Accountant General
questions.explanation: The retirement savings account is managed by the Pension Fund Administrator (PFA).

questions.question: The responsibility for monitoring salary payments for compliance purposes primarily rests with the:
options: Office of the Head of Service
questions.explanation: Internal Audit monitors salary payments for compliance (Rule 4.44).

questions.question: An officer may change their Pension Fund Administrator (PFA) at what frequency?
questions.explanation: Officers can change their Pension Fund Administrator once every year (Rule 7.24, 13.49).

subcategories.name: Conduct & Ethics
subcategories.description: Rules on confidentiality, political neutrality, private practice, conflicts of interest, and moral conduct (Chapter 10, 14, 15).

questions.question: An Officer on leave of absence shall not accept any paid employment without obtaining express approval from the:
options: Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
questions.explanation: An Officer on leave of absence shall not accept any paid employment without previously obtaining the express approval from the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (Rule 120235).

questions.question: Public officers are strictly prohibited from engaging in which type of activity while in service?
questions.explanation: Engaging in partisan political activities is listed as an act of Serious Misconduct (Rule 100402(g)) and officers are barred from partisan politics unless they resign (Rule 3.43).
questions.chapter: Chapter 10 ‚Äì Serious Misconduct / Chapter 3 ‚Äì Political Activities

questions.question: The use of an official position to benefit family members is considered:
questions.explanation: Holding more than one full-time paid job, Nepotism or any other form of preferential treatment are acts of Serious Misconduct (Rule 100402(q), (r)).

questions.question: An officer may engage in private practice or outside employment only:
options: If it is unrelated to their official duties
With written permission from the Minister/Head of Service
If they are medical doctors or university lecturers
questions.explanation: In accordance with the provisions of the Regulated and other Professions Private Practice Prohibition Act... exemptions shall be granted to private Medical Practitioners and Law Lecturers in the Universities and other public servants... (Rule 100425). Generally, outside employment requires written approval from the Minister or Head of Service.

questions.question: Which of these is explicitly classified as Serious Misconduct (Rule 100402)?
options: Being absent for three days without leave
questions.explanation: Sexual harassment is listed among the acts of Serious Misconduct (Rule 100402(w)).

questions.question: Officers must report any contact with foreign intelligence agents immediately to:
questions.explanation: Any contact with foreign intelligence agents must be immediately reported to security agencies.

questions.question: Officers are prohibited from accepting gifts or gratifications if the gift is given to them:
options: In connection with any official act or duty
questions.explanation: An Officer shall not accept gifts or gratifications in connection with any official act or duty (Rule 10.6).

questions.question: An officer may appeal decisions related to postings and transfers. True or False?
questions.explanation: Officers may appeal against posting and transfer decisions (Rule 12.19).

questions.question: Which body specifically handles cases of breaches of the Code of Conduct for Public Officers?
questions.explanation: The Code of Conduct Tribunal specifically handles breaches of the Code of Conduct for Public Officers (Rule 10.28).

questions.question: The PSR requires that officers must maintain political neutrality in the discharge of their duties. True or False?
questions.explanation: Officers must maintain political neutrality in the discharge of their duties (Rule 3.19).

questions.question: If an officer makes a valuable mineral discovery (Rule 100426), they are required to report it to Government and are prohibited from:
